comments:
3.0 M6 on OS X exporting a feature as a deployable zip file does not work.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Jan 26, 2004 10:01:33.317
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "PDE Export".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 2
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.Config.<init>(Config.java:29)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.Config.<init>(Config.java:33)
        at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.AbstractScriptGenerator.setConfigInfo(AbstractScriptGenerator.java:
73)
        at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.setConfigInfo(FeatureExportJob.java:
179)
        at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.makeScript(FeatureExportJob.java:
169)
        at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.doExport(FeatureExportJob.java:101)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.BaseExportJob.doExports(BaseExportJob.java:
179)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.BaseExportJob.run(BaseExportJob.java:133)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:62)
*** Bug 44781 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Wassim, I investigated that with the code base that is in HEAD and the problem
comes from the fact that when the FeatureBuildScriptGenerator is called, all
information relative to os/ws/arch that are listed in the feature are passed as
one. Note that this information is the list of all os/arch/ws supported by the
feature.

This results in a happy mess with either an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException or
some funky configurations like linux/win32/ppc (this is visible in the ROOTxxx
target in the build.xml). 

In order to avoid this confusion, the script generator needs to know for which
configuration the feature is being built. When I mean configuration, I mean a
combination of os/ws/arch that will make sense.

I don't think anything fancy should be done here. The user should have a dialog
(or a preference page) that allows him to specify the targeted config and this
will be given to the generator. By default, this config could be set to the
config of the target platform.
*** Bug 47290 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 47476 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

> By default, this config could be set to the config of the target platform.
I like the sound of this.  Anything more would be overkill.
